article_title: Turkey Says France Missed Terror Warnings
article_text:
ANTALYA, Turkey—Turkish officials revealed Monday that they had identified one of the Paris assailants as a terrorism suspect and notified French authorities twice to no avail, highlighting intelligence lapses that plague cooperation among Western allies amid mounting security risks from extremist militants.

Omar Ismail Mostefai, named by French police as one of the seven suspects involved in Friday’s violent attacks in Paris, arrived in Turkey in 2013 and was flagged most recently in June as a terrorism threat to...
